    • getSymptomsAsString

      public String getSymptomsAsString()
      Returns the symptoms as a concatenated string, separated by commas.
      Returns:
      A string with all symptoms concatenated and separated by commas.

    • parseSymptomsFromString

      public List<String> parseSymptomsFromString(String symptomsString)
      Converts a string of concatenated symptoms back into a list of strings, so, when we retrieve this data from database, we can obtain again the list instead of a string. The symptoms in the string should be separated by commas and optional spaces.
      Parameters:
      symptomsString - string containing symptoms separated by commas.
      Returns:
      A list of strings, where each string is a symptom from the input string.

    • getDateAsString

      public String getDateAsString()
      Get the date and return it in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
      Returns:
      the date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd" in a String.

    • setDateAsString

      public void setDateAsString(String dateString)
      Sets the date for the medical record from a string, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
      Parameters:
      dateString - The string representation of the date to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string cannot be parsed into a valid LocalDate.
